schedule.topic: Course overview and goals, logistics, software, introduction to computing and to computers
Basic Python: primitive scalar object types, basic operators, variables and assignment, casting and conversions, syntactic and semantic errors, notion of functions
Lab: How to use the Spyder editor, experimenting with basic python concepts, code debugging, Autolab and Autograder
Non-scalar data types, strings: Basic operations with string data type (length, indexing, slicing, replacing, finding), operator overloading, conversions, basic I/O (print(), input())
Boolean data types: definitions, logical operators, flow control using conditional constructs, indentation and scoping
Lab: Use of all primitive data types, program branching and decision-making using conditionals, basic I/O
Iteration: Repeated actions using while loops, use of counters, break statement, scope of variables
Iteration: Repeated actions using for loops, ranging over numbers and strings, nested loops and scoping
Lab: Flow control using while and for loops, variable scope
Functions for decomposition, abstraction, and reusability: definition, arguments, keyword arguments and default values, returning values, stack frames, local and global scoping
Special functions, modules, and import: main(), help() and docstrings, signals and exceptions, import statements, dot notation
Lab: Functions, testing and debugging with built-in tools, use and creation of imported modules (Numpy)

Non-scalar data types, lists: tuples, mutability and lists, creating lists, retrieving and adding elements, slicing and cloning, operator overloading and concatenation, aliasing, list comprehension, methods available for lists
Sports Day
Lab: Operations on and manipulation of lists data types
Partial assessment test I: All topics considered so far in the course
Non-scalar data types, multi-dimensional arrays: lists to represent multi-dimensional data arrays, use of the Numpy module, applications in numeric linear algebra and image processing
Lab: Multi-dimensional data arrays, use of Numpy functionalities
Structured non-scalar data types, dictionaries: creating strong paired data using dictionaries, iterating over the items and over the keys, accessing items, adding and removing items
Regular expressions for searching patterns in strings: Ra module, character groups, quantifiers, extraction, position, finding multiple matches
Lab: Use of dictionaries and regular expressions for structuring and searching data
Spring Break
Spring Break
Spring Break
Reading and writing files: opening and closing files, error codes, paths, reading lines, writing formatted text
Files, programs, and user inputs: creating, deleting, and renaming files and folders, running programs, reading command line arguments
Lab: Using I/O from/to files and command line to manipulate bases of data
Object-oriented programming: abstract data types and classes, methods, instantiation, designing modular and reusable programs using abstract data types
Object-oriented programming: inheritance, encapsulation and information hiding, iterators
Lab: Designing code using object-oriented programming
Divide-and-conquer paradigm: divide-conquer-combine, from iteration to recursion, mathematical induction, advantages and challenges, factorial and binary search examples
Divide-and-conquer paradigm: mergesort and quicksort examples, fractals, tower of Hanoi, memory and time requirements
Lab: Application of the divide-and-conquer paradigm, use of recursion
Efficiency of algorithms: notion of complexity, number of operations, worst case behavior, big O notation, basic examples of linear, log-linear, log, polynomial, exponential complexities
Efficiency of algorithms: complexity analysis of different algorithms for search and sorting tasks
Partial assessment test II: Focus on the topics considered from the first assessment test up to now
Data visualization and animation using Matplotlib: overview, main functionalities, data plotting
Data visualization and animation using Matplotlib: complex data plots, basic animations
Lab: Use of Matplotlib for data visualization and animation
Simulation models: agent-based models, Cellular Automata for deterministic simulation of spatially distributed process
Simulation models: random number generation in a computer, notion of Monte Carlo techniques, Genetic Algorithms for solving complex optimization problems
Lab: Implementing simulation models in application scenarios of interest
Combinatorial models: knapsack optimization problems, practical applications, greedy approaches, dynamic programming approach, complexity
Combinatorial models: graph optimization problems, finding the shortest path, finding the min-cut, practical applications, complexity
Lab: Algorithms for combinatorial models
FINAL EXAM
